title: CN Level 10 — Secure Web App Networking
concept: End-to-end design of a secure web application deployment: segmentation, HTTPS, firewalls.

challenges.question: Which high-level architecture best represents a secure web application deployment?

options.A: Internet → database server (public IP) → web server (private IP)
options.B: Internet → load balancer in public subnet → web/app servers in private subnet → database in deeper private subnet
options.C: Internet → single server with web app and database exposed on all ports
options.D: Internet → firewall → all servers on the same flat network

challenges.explanation: Placing public-facing components in a public subnet and sensitive components in private subnets is a common secure design.

challenges.question: How do HTTPS and firewall rules together help secure a web application?

options.A: HTTPS provides encryption; firewall restricts which ports and sources can reach internal components
options.B: HTTPS replaces the need for any firewalls
options.C: Firewalls provide encryption and HTTPS provides routing
options.D: They only protect against hardware failures

challenges.explanation: HTTPS encrypts data in transit; firewalls enforce which traffic is allowed between the Internet and internal servers.

challenges.question: In network security, a DMZ (demilitarized zone) is:

options.A: A fully trusted internal network for databases
options.B: A network segment that hosts public-facing services, separated from both Internet and internal LAN
options.C: A feature of TCP congestion control

challenges.explanation: A DMZ isolates public-facing servers (like reverse proxy/load balancer) from the core internal network.

challenges.question: Which of the following is the BEST set of logs/metrics to monitor for security and performance in a web app environment?

options.B: Web server access/error logs, firewall logs, and metrics like latency/error rates
options.D: Only number of open browser tabs on clients

challenges.explanation: Combining application, network, and system metrics/logs helps detect attacks and performance issues.

challenges.question: Which option best illustrates applying the principle of least privilege in a secure web app network?

options.A: Allow all ports between web servers and database servers
options.B: Give the database user full admin rights on the OS
options.C: Allow only specific ports between app and DB, and give the DB user only required permissions
options.D: Use the same admin account for all services

challenges.explanation: Least privilege means allowing only the minimal access needed—both in firewall rules and in account permissions.
